intro: Oplismenus pseudoundulatifolius, commonly known as the zigzag sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive zigzag pattern along their edges, giving it its common name. Oplismenus pseudoundulatifolius thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
